name: 蔡銘修
objective: Explore the principles, design, and practical applications of game-based digital learning. The content includes the advantages, characteristics, limitations, technology, media, design and development, systems, practical cases, and future trends of game-based digital learning.
schedule:
01 09/14 Course Description
02 09/21 Types of  digital game-based learning: gamification vs Game based learning
03 09/28 Features and goals of digital game-based learning
04 10/05 Gamification: Minecraft
05 10/12 Gamification: 8 Core Drives in Octalysis
06 10/19 Group discussion
07 10/26 Flow Theory 
08 11/02 Gamification: related research- Pagamo & classcraft
09 11/09 Midterm Week
10 11/16 The characteristics and objectives of digital game-based learning
11 11/23 Digital game-based learning: Hours of code & codecombat
12 11/30 Digital game-based learning: related research-Mini-flipped Game-based learning
13 12/07 Group discussion
14 12/14 The evaluation of digital game-based learning
15 12/21 VR & game based learning
16 12/28 Final Report I
17 01/04 Final Report II
18 01/11 Final exam week
scorePolicy:
attendance 30%
Mid-term report 30%
Final report 40%

One,
1~2 students in a group, choose one of the following projest
1. Game-based digital learning is useful for learning (paper from SSCI)
2. Game-based digital learning is not useful for learning (paper from SSCI)
3. Develop an educational digital game (real product)
4. Use game-based digital learning to assist classroom instruction (experimental or action research)
5. Observe the process of using game-based digital learning by students (or family members)
6. Other issues related to the course(need to be approved by instructor)
two,
This course needs to join the Line group for informal learning.
materials: Using the teaching material the instructor made.
